page.title: 01DESCRIPTION OF LUSTON AREA
page.content: Our area is found in the county of {Hereford and Worcester}.It is located 3 miles to the north of Leominster and 9 miles south of Ludlow.The landscape is agricultural and ranges in height from 76m in the middle of the area to 137m towards the sides. There are several small streams which flow southward to join the River Lugg just north of Leominster.The main settlements of the area are the villages of{Luston}and{Eye}. The main {A 49 }passes through the eastern part of the area in a north/south direction as does the{B 4361}which also passes through the area.There is also a railway line passing through the area going to Shrewsbury in the north and Hereford to the south.{Agriculture }is the dominant feature of the area with the majority of the fields being good quality grassland and crops.
